The color of materials can be affected by a combination of factors, such as particle size, packing density, crystal structure, and chemical composition. As the particle size of the pigment decreases, the color tends to be brighter or lighter.

In contrast, the particle size of (Bi 0.80Ta 0.20) 2O 3.40 was smaller than those of other samples and the color of (Bi 0.80Ta 0.20) 2O 3.40 was relatively light. The pale coloration can be attributed not only to the change of the crystal structure but also the reduction of the particle size.
